fieldData.title: New measures for the teleworking in the public administration
fieldData.title_nationalLanguage: Misure per il lavoro agile nella pubblica amministrazione nel periodo emergenziale
fieldData.calc_minorCategory: Protection of workers, adaptation of workplace
fieldData.descriptionBackgroundInfo: On 19 October 2020, the Minister for Public Administration issued a new set of measures relating to the teleworking arrangements for the public employment to face the so-called second wave of COVID-19 infections in the country.The Decree, published on the Official Gazette no. 268 on 28 October 2002, applies to all the public administrations listed by the Legislative Decree no. 165/2001 (art. 1, c. 2), namely all the public administrations excluding the armed forces.
fieldData.descriptionContentOfMeasure: The Decree established the teleworking for the public employees as an ordinary work arrangement until 31 December 2020, hence not requiring an individual agreement with the employer when adopted, as according to the Law no. 81/2017 (article 19).Each public administration is required to organise and schedule the turnover among all the employees, in order to ensure that no more than 50% of the personnel work on site, while the remaining share work through teleworking. However, the share of public employees working remotely can be increased by the executives in each administration according to the spread of the COVID-19 infections in the area.The Decree also established that all the meetings have to be organised on-line: in presence meetings are forbidden, unless there are specific and justified reasons.Finally, the Decree introduced working time flexibility to the personnel working in presence, in terms of entry and exit time, as a way to prevent gatherings at the entrances.
fieldData.descriptionUseOfMeasure: The measures have been introduced very recently: information on the application are not available yet. However, we can expect the adoption of these measures by the whole public administration in the country.
fieldData.descriptionInvolvementOfSocialPartners: The main trade unions in the public sector (Fp Cgil, Fp Cisl, Fpl Uil and Uilpa) have not been involved in the definition of these measures.
fieldData.statusOfRegulation: New aspects included into existing measure
